Package renderer.algebra

Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • renderer.algebra.ArrayBase
      • renderer.algebra.Vector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    public class Vector
extends ArrayBase
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    The Vector class represents a mathematical vector and provides methods to manipulate it.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_NAME
      The default name of the vector.

    • Method Detail

      • createRandom

        public static Vector createRandom​(java.lang.String name,
                                  int nRows)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a random vector of the specified size. Each element is filled with a random value between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the vector
        nRows - the size of the vector (must be strictly positive)
        Returns:
        a new vector of size nRows filled with random values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the vector dimension is invalid

      • norm

        public final double norm()
        Computes the Euclidean norm (L2 norm) of the vector.
        Returns:
        the Euclidean norm of the vector (always non-negative)

      • normalize

        public Vector normalize()
        Returns a normalized vector. This method does NOT modify the current vector. If the norm is 0, returns a new zero vector of the same size.
        Returns:
        a new Vector that is the normalized version of this vector

      • homogeneousPoint

        public Vector homogeneousPoint()
        Returns the homogeneous representation of the Vector as a point. This method does NOT modify the current vector.
        Returns:
        a new Vector with the same elements plus an additional 1.0 at the end

      • homogeneousVector

        public Vector homogeneousVector()
        Returns the homogeneous representation of the Vector as a direction. This method does NOT modify the current vector.
        Returns:
        a new Vector with the same elements plus an additional 0.0 at the end

      • dot

        public double dot​(Vector v)
        Computes the dot product (scalar product) between this vector and another vector. Both vectors must have the same size.
        Parameters:
        v - the vector to compute the dot product with
        Returns:
        the dot product (a scalar value)
        Throws:
        SizeMismatchException - if the two vectors are not the same size

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the vector in MATLAB-compatible format. The format is: "name = [v0, v1, ..., vn]';"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a MATLAB-compatible string representation of the vector

      • set

        public void set​(int i,
                double value)
        Sets the i-th coordinate to the given value. This method MODIFIES the current vector.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the coordinate to set
        value - the value to set the coordinate to

      • zeros

        public Vector zeros()
        Sets all elements of the vector to 0. This method MODIFIES the current vector.
        Returns:
        this vector (modified) filled with zeros

      • ones

        public Vector ones()
        Sets all elements of the vector to 1. This method MODIFIES the current vector.
        Returns:
        this vector (modified) filled with ones

      • get

        public double get​(int i)
        Gets the i-th coordinate of the Vector.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the coordinate to get
        Returns:
        the value of the i-th coordinate

      • clamp

        public Vector clamp​(double min,
                    double max)
        Clamps the values of the Vector between the given minimum and maximum. This method does NOT modify the current vector.
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum value
        max - the maximum value
        Returns:
        a copy of this vector with clamped values

      • subtract

        public Vector subtract​(Vector v)
        Vector/Vector subtraction : this - v. This method does NOT modify the current vector or the operand.
        Parameters:
        v - the vector to subtract
        Returns:
        a new Vector containing the result of this - v
        Throws:
        SizeMismatchException - if the vector sizes do not match for subtraction

      • scale

        public Vector scale​(double f)
        Vector scaling : f * this. This method does NOT modify the current vector.
        Parameters:
        f - the scalar to multiply by
        Returns:
        a new Vector containing the result of f * this

      • add

        public Vector add​(Vector v)
        Vector/Vector addition : this + v. This method does NOT modify the current vector or the operand.
        Parameters:
        v - the vector to add
        Returns:
        a new Vector containing the result of this + v
        Throws:
        SizeMismatchException - if the vector sizes do not match for addition

      • cross

        public Vector cross​(Vector v)
        Returns the cross product : this × v. This operation is only possible in dimension 3. This method does NOT modify the current vector or the operand.
        Parameters:
        v - the vector to compute cross product with
        Returns:
        a new Vector containing the result of this × v
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either vector is not 3-dimensional

      • set

        public void set​(double... values)
        Set the values of the vector. This method MODIFIES the current vector.
        Parameters:
        values - the values (can be a double[] or doubles values separated by a comma)
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the number of values does not match the vector size

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Gets the X component (the first element) of the vector.
        Returns:
        the value at index 0
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the vector size is less than 1

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Gets the Y component (the second element) of the vector.
        Returns:
        the value at index 1
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the vector size is less than 2

      • getZ

        public double getZ()
        Gets the Z component (the third element) of the vector.
        Returns:
        the value at index 2
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the vector size is less than 3

      • toMatrix

        public Matrix toMatrix()
        Converts this vector to a column matrix. This method does NOT modify the current vector.
        Returns:
        a new Matrix representing this vector as a column matrix

      • clone

        protected Vector clone()
        Creates and returns a copy of this vector.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a new Vector that is a copy of this vector

      • getSubVector

        public Vector getSubVector​(int start,
                           int numberOfComponent)
        Return a subvector from start with numberOfComponent components. This method does NOT modify the current vector.
        Parameters:
        start - the start index
        numberOfComponent - the number of components
        Returns:
        a new Vector containing the extracted subvector
